entry.title: Re: Price is not getting populated in components tab of w...
entry.content:
To your question "price will be picked from material and Planning Plant combination or the plant assigned in component line for material combination", the price is picked from the plant assigned in the component line, not from the order‚Äôs planning plant. In other words if your work order is created in Planning Plant YYYY, but the component line specifies Plant XXXX, the system will look at Material 1234 in Plant XXXX for valuation. This is why the MAP of 100 in Plant XXXX should be used ‚Äî but if valuation variant config is missing or incorrect, it defaults to zero.

Check the below areas:

Go to OKP8 ‚Üí Material Valuation tab. Ensure one of the strategies includes Moving Average Price or Price according to price control in material master. Example Strategy sequence could be Planned price 1 / Moving Average Price / Standard Price

Confirm that Material 1234 has MAP maintained in Plant XXXX. Check if the material is flagged as non-valuated or has special procurement that bypasses valuation.

Ensure the correct costing variant is assigned to your order type. The costing variant links to the valuation variant, so if the wrong one is assigned, MAP won‚Äôt be picked.

Hello All,
I would like to inquire about Migration of Accounting Transaction Data in SAP ByDesign, and more specifically - Inventory.

I have the following situation: Since I have to import the Inventory in the new logistic area in my new company ID, the serial numbers that I would like to import have been already used in the storage area in my old company ID, and therefore they can't be received in the new logistic area, since the serial number seems to be a global object for the whole tenant.

And my question is what is the most optimal solution of migrating inventory with all those serial numbers that has been used in the previous logistics area?

Thanks in advance! I will be looking forward to your suggestions and guidance.

entry.title: C_PURCHASEORDERITEMDEX - Add the creation date field of the purchase order item
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I recently raised a case with SAP regarding the standard CDS View for purchase order items, C_PURCHASEORDERITEMDEX, which currently returns the header creation date for all items. After reviewing the case, the SAP support team confirmed that this is the expected behavior and suggested submitting an idea on their Influence platform. My ERP is S/4HANA Public Cloud.

The goal of this blog post is to gather support from the community so that this improvement can be prioritized. If you agree that having the correct item-level creation date would add value, please take a moment to vote for my idea on the SAP Influence website. Your vote can make a real difference!

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/362226

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

Miquel

entry.title: Rename user identity (username) in Cloud ALM (BTP)
entry.content:
Hello,

We have been using Cloud Identity Service (CIS) for several years and have set it up as the identity provider for our Cloud ALM. 
Unfortunately, we created the user names in the wrong format at the time, which now confronts us with a major challenge. 
A corporate identity provider (Entra ID) is used behind the Cloud Identity Service. We would now like to use several corporate identity providers and/or the internal user store from CIS in addition. Unfortunately, we no longer have the option of setting up conditional authentication with the users we have already created, as the domain does not exist in the user name.

Is there a way to change the user names without deleting and recreating them in Cloud ALM / BTP? We are talking about ~400 users here. Because when I change a user in Cloud ALM (or BTP) to a new user, the assigned objects in Cloud ALM disappear from that user. When I change the attribute in the corporate IdP, a new user is created.

Current format of the USERNAME />Desired format of the USERNAME

The problem would also arise if a company changed the domain and the user names (domain) had to be changed.

Can you help us with this?

Best regards,


--- Support Assistant ---

Q: External API Management
Integration with External Ticket Systems
A: no
Q: SAP Cloud ALM Integration with External Chat Systems
SAP Cloud ALM Integration with External Chat Systems
A: no
Q: Management of External APIs
Management of External APIs
A: no
Q: Business Accelerator Hub
Business Accelerator Hub
A: no


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Rename user identity (username) in Cloud ALM (BTP)
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Greetings from SAP Support.

Although the user name cannot be changed directly in SAP Cloud ALM, you can edit user first name and last name in SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS).

After making the change, please log out and log in again to the SAP Cloud ALM tenant to ensure the update is reflected.

After the next daily synchronization job, the updated name will also be reflected in Cloud ALM BTP Subaccount.

3609235 - Details on the synchronization of data between Cloud ALM BTP Subaccount and Cloud ALM tenant - SAP for Me

Best regards,

SAP Support

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Readiness check report not showing for S4hana 2025
entry.content:
The product version can be selected in the Readiness Check is depends on the Simplification Item Catalog (SI Catalog) as well as the current product version installed on the system.
To update the latest version of the SI Catalog:

  1. Apply the latest version of the note 2399707
  2. The SI Content can be updated via SE38 -> Run the report "/SDF/RC_START_CHECK" -> Update catalog with Latest version from SAP, then it will automatically update the SI catalog via the SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL destination to SAP backend.
  3. It is also possible to manually download the SI Content from https://me.sap.com/sic, then upload it via the report "/sdf/rc_start_check"

entry.title: Re: Payment Block Not Transferred to AR Line Item from Bi...
entry.content:
Payment terms in Cloud only control due dates and cash discount conditions. The payment block field in AR line items is independent and not linked by default to payment terms. In on‚Äëpremise, you could enhance the transfer logic with a user exit. In Public Cloud, user exits are not available ‚Äî only released BAdIs and custom logic.

So the recommendation is implement a custom logic enhancement in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using the released BAdI for AR line item posting. This will allow you to replicate the on‚Äëpremise behavior: transfer the payment block from payment term to AR line item.

entry.title: Re: About SAP Cloud ALM roles
entry.content:
To add to this, there are also scenarios where the "Cross Global Administrator" will not be sufficient to manage everything.

The "Cross Global Administrator" Role Collection will grant authorizations for all functionality both owned by and executed by SAP Cloud ALM itself. For scenarios where SAP Cloud ALM acts as a trigger to execute functionality within other products, the Cross Global Administrator Role Collection will not contain the additional specific roles related to that functionality. The Role Collections specific to those functionalities within other products will need to be assigned to any user that is expected to work with them. These scenarios currently include:

  • Integrating the Cloud Integration Automation Service
  • Enabling Transport Management - SAP Cloud Transport Management Service

Hi, 

This came very abruptly and is very poorly communicated. I've been preparing for the exam and planned to take it in January.

"This SAP Certification Exam will be replaced with a practical exam by end of January. No exams can be scheduled after December 31st. Scheduling will be open again once the new exam version is available. " Why would the exam version be stopped without having a replacement in place while the content should stay the same?

This is very irresponsible to the time and resources we've invested in the certification. While we're ready for examination and have a deadline to adhere to, we're subjected to the change of format without sufficient warning, which we would need to spent more time to prepare for.

Is there a way we could access the certification exam of the "old" format for the month of January at least?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,

Ivy

entry.title: Handling Stock Split Between Bins Based on Capacity
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am working on an SAP EWM setup and need assistance with a specific stock putaway scenario.

Scenario:

  • We have 3 bins in a warehouse:

    • S001-01: 100 units capacity

    • S001-02: 100 units capacity

    • S001-03: 100 units capacity

Requirements:

  1. If we receive a batch of 100 units, the system should place the full 100 units in an empty bin (e.g., S001-01).

  2. If a bin has 50 units already and we receive another 50 units, the system should add the 50 units to the existing bin.

  3. If we receive 150 units, the system should:

    • Place 50 units in the partially filled bin (e.g., S001-01, which already has 50 units).

    • Place the remaining 100 units in another bin (e.g., S001-02).

Issue:

I have tried configuring the system, but it is not working as expected. It doesn't seem to split the stock between bins based on available space.

Questions:

  • Can this behavior be achieved through standard configuration in SAP EWM, or would it require custom enhancements (e.g., BAdIs or user exits)?

  • Are there any specific settings or strategies I should be looking into for handling capacity-based putaway and stock splitting across multiple bins?

Any help or guidance would be appreciated!

Regards,

Chand.

entry.title: Dependency for overhead and labour hours calculation, including setup time in master recipe.
entry.content:
Hi all,

I would like to create a dependency for the overhead hours and the labour hours, but I cannot quite figure out the dependency syntax.

  • I have reference characteristic LABOUR_HOURS for labour hours (PLPOD-VGW01)
  • I have a reference characteristics OVERHEAD_HOURS for overhead hours (PLPOD-VGW02).
  • I have a reference characteristic ORDER_QUANTITY that picks up the sales order quantity (VBAP-KWMENG).

The formulas always include a setup time of 1 hour, that is independent of the production quantity. If 10 pieces are produced, the setup is 1 hour, if 1000 pieces are produced, the setup time is also 1 hour.

To labour hours is calculated as below: 

Total labour time is 1 + 1,5 * production quantity.

I have the following syntax:

$SELF.LABOUR_HOURS = 1 + 1,5 * $ROOT.ORDER_QUANTITY

For some reason, this syntax does not produce any results. What is wrong with this syntax?

How can I include this 1 hour of setup time in the dependency syntax? I want to prevent this 1 hour being added for every piece. For a production of 100 pieces:

Correct: 1 + 1,5*100 = 151 hours for the total production cycle.

Incorrect: 1 + 1,5*100 = 151 hours per piece produced (which it what I expect will happen with the syntax above).

Is it possible to create and use a dependency to calculate the total labour hours instead of a calculation per piece? 

What is the best approach for this?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: How to notify Non-SuccessFactors User via mail about...
entry.content:
Hi @ArunSuresh3 , thanks a lot for your response and for outlining the CC Role option.

If I understand your suggestion correctly, this approach would require us to replicate multiple workflows (and corresponding business rules), for example per legal entity and/or per project manager, in order to populate the external email address accordingly. Given that: project managers change frequently, and the solution would affect more than 2,500 employees, this would lead to a very high number of workflows and ongoing maintenance effort, which does not seem scalable in our case. Do you see any way to dynamically populate the external email address in a single workflow based on a string field (e.g. via rule logic)?

I‚Äôd be very interested to hear if you‚Äôve seen any scalable real-life implementation for this kind of requirement within SuccessFactors.

Data in the source SAP ERP is correct (no duplicates)

No changes were made to the model or job around that time

What could be the reason for duplication only on specific days?

How can I fix this issue and prevent it in the future?

Any guidance would be highly appreciated.

entry.content:
Hello,

I'm in a situation where my warehouse will move to 1 site to another one.

So the output for delivery (for example or warehouse order) need to be printed in 2 different printers in 2 different sites.

I read a lot of documentation and if I understand well we have a relation 1 to 1 between the print queue and the physical printer (https://me.sap.com/notes/2757763/E)

So I was thinking to set my printing to DEFAULT and then the user manually set the output item to the right printing (Until the move ends).
I saw in this documentation that you can edit the output item with status "In preparation" : "https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/dc2fa399c50f4a32a2513130ad0531eb.html?locale=en-US"

but I could find the way in my system, in the "Manage Output Item" App, I have the only option  "sent":

Emmanuel.

entry.title: UoM Conversion Issue: Decimal NOS Generated During GR for Variable KG Receipts
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

We are facing an issue related to Unit of Measure (UoM) conversion during Goods Receipt in SAP MM.

Scenario Details:

  • Material has Base UoM maintained as KG

  • Alternate / Stock Keeping UoM maintained as NOS

  • Conversion maintained in ME11 as:

    • 25 KG = 1 NOS (in some cases 30 KG = 1 NOS)

  • During Goods Receipt, when material is received with variable weight (for example, 28 KG), the system calculates stock quantity proportionately and generates decimal NOS (e.g., 1.200 NOS).

Business Requirement:
Physically, the material is received as 1 Nos only, irrespective of minor weight variation. However, SAP system is generating fractional NOS quantities based on KG conversion, which does not match physical inventory.

Issue:
We need to understand:

  1. Whether SAP standard supports restricting the stock quantity in whole NOS only, even when KG receipt quantity varies.

  2. Whether any standard configuration, rounding rule, or enhancement exists to avoid decimal NOS generation during GR.

  3. Recommended SAP best practice for handling such variable-weight, single-unit materials.

Current Impact:

  • Mismatch between physical stock and system stock in NOS

  • Inventory reporting inconsistencies

  • End-user confusion during GR and stock monitoring

Kindly advise on:

  • Standard SAP solution / limitation confirmation

  • Recommended configuration or process workaround (without custom development, if possible)

entry.title: Re: SAP BW CompositeProvider join limitation with mixed j...
entry.content: Multiple joins are possible in CP, but the performance will be a bottleneck. Try creating a CV and introduce input parameters in the lowest node of CVs to limit number of records flowing to top layer, this way the join gets performed in CV with selected less data. consume this CV back into the CP.

entry.title: Re: Dependency for overhead and labour hours calculation,...
entry.content:
Why your current syntax doesn‚Äôt work is because of decimal separator which is comma in your case but SAP's recommendation is to have dot. Also, by default, operation times in routings are stored as per unit values. If you assign 151 to VGW01, the system interprets it as ‚Äú151 hours per piece.‚Äù That‚Äôs why you see multiplication happening incorrectly.

Below would be the Best Approach

Create a custom reference characteristic for total labour hours (e.g., ZTOTAL_LABOUR).

  • Formula: 1 + 1.5 * $ROOT.ORDER_QUANTITY.
  • This gives you the correct total cycle time.

Keep VGW01 (Labour time per unit) as a derived value:

  • ZTOTAL_LABOUR / $ROOT.ORDER_QUANTITY.
  • This way, SAP routing still gets per‚Äëunit values, but you can report total hours separately.

Overhead hours (VGW02) can be modeled similarly:

  • Example: $SELF.OVERHEAD_HOURS = 0.5 * $ROOT.ORDER_QUANTITY

entry.title: Shipping point issue in Return to Vendor
entry.content:
Hello All,

My Enterprise structure-

Plant - P001

Sales Org - S001

Distribution channels - D1 (Domestic), D2 (Import)

Division - 00

Plant is linked to both S001,D1 and S001,D2

Now we are trying to create a Return to Vendor order and we are getting the error No shipping point could be determined for Shipping condition , Loading Group 001, Plant P001.

Our supplier is extended to two sales areas S001, D1,00 and S001,D2,00 . But this supplier is an Import supplier hence S001,D2,00 is the one of concern here. Shipping condition in this Sales Area is marked as Z1. However in the error we could see that the Shipping condition determined is blank. 
Is this because in the SPRO configuration ‚ÄúShipping data for plant‚Äù, the Sales area for our plant P001 is updated as S001,D1,00.

Is it due to this configuration that the system is trying to search the shipping condition for S001,D1,00 in the BP? Because for this sales area, the shipping condition is blank.

Need advise on how to handle this ?

entry.title: Re: URL routing for CAP apps across BTP subaccounts without workzone
entry.content:
@Emanuel_Huser 
Please refer to KBA: https://me.sap.com/notes/0003649468

In short: 

  • SM59: Create Type G destination in each environment with the target host URL
  • Target Mapping: Set URL path only (omit hostname), specify System Alias as the destination name

entry.title: Re: Creating Role Collections in SAP BTP Using the New 'role-collections' Property
entry.content:
Hi @ruben_alvarez ,

it is possible to that but they need/get a different name using Cloud Foundry variables defined within the mta.yaml like this. This will override the role-collections of the xs-security.json.  Alternative option is to manually handle the xsuaa service configuration and update the service using the terminal. Another option is to create different subaccounts for your purpose.

resources:
  - name: incident-management-auth
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: xsuaa
      service-plan: application
      path: ./xs-security.json
      config:
        xsappname: incident-management-${org}-${space}
        tenant-mode: dedicated
        role-collections:
          - name: "people_request_Admin ${space})"
            description: "generated"
            role-template-references:
              - "$XSAPPNAME.admin"

entry.title: MCP Server Tool Test Fails in Joule Agent with 6010 Error
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I am facing an issue while testing an MCP server tool in the Joule Agent and would appreciate your guidance.

Scenario

I have implemented an MCP server using FastMCP with a custom tool that executes a SPARQL query against SAP HANA Knowledge Graph. The server runs in streamable-http mode.

Observations

  • The MCP server starts successfully.

  • All tools are listed correctly when the MCP server is registered.
  • The tool metadata is visible and selectable in the Joule Agent.
  • However, when I configure the Destination and attempt to test the tool, the test fails with Error 6010.

Key Point

The same MCP server and tool work correctly when tested locally and are properly displayed in the MCP server. The failure only occurs during destination-based testing in the Joule Agent.

Environment

  • MCP Framework: FastMCP

  • Transport: streamable-http

  • Backend: SAP HANA Cloud (Knowledge Graph / SPARQL)

  • Authentication: Destination-based

  • Error: 6010 during tool test

Question

  • What does error 6010 indicate in the context of Joule Agent MCP destination testing?

  • Are there any specific requirements for:

    • MCP endpoint structure

    • Response format

    • Authentication headers

    • Health or metadata endpoints

  • Is additional configuration required for FastMCP‚Äìbased servers to be compatible with Joule Agent destinations?

Any guidance or documentation references would be very helpful.

sap-joule-studio-mcp-server:true property added in destination
"
import os
import json
import logging
from typing import Dict, Any

from hdbcli import dbapi
from mcp.server.fastmcp import FastMCP

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --------------------------------------------------
# MCP Server
# --------------------------------------------------
mcp = FastMCP(
    name="sap-hana-kg-mcp",
    host="0.0.0.0",
    port=int(os.getenv("PORT", 8080)),
)

# --------------------------------------------------
# HANA Connection via VCAP_SERVICES
# --------------------------------------------------
def get_hana_connection():
    #vcap = json.loads(os.environ["VCAP_SERVICES"])
    #hana = vcap["hana"][0]["credentials"]

    return dbapi.connect(
        user="DBADMIN",
        password="Admin@2103",
        address="776c2b5d-0605-4ce0-b71b-a0399e6631a2.hna0.prod-us10.hanacloud.ondemand.com",
        port=443,
        encrypt="true",
        sslValidateCertificate="true",
    )

# --------------------------------------------------
# Utility: JSON-safe rows
# --------------------------------------------------
def serialize_rows(rowsüòû
    return [
        [str(col) if col is not None else None for col in row]
        for row in rows
    ]

# --------------------------------------------------
# MCP Tool
# --------------------------------------------------
@mcp.tool(
    description="Execute a SPARQL query against SAP HANA Knowledge Graph and return results"
)
def execute_sparql(query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """
    Input:
      - query: SPARQL query string

    Output:
      - status, row_count, results
    """
    try:
        GRAPH_URI = "http://new_test_mission_faqhanahotspots.org/"

        conn = get_hana_connection()
        cursor = conn.cursor()

        cursor.callproc(
            "SPARQL_EXECUTE",
            (
                query,
                "Query from Joule MCP",
                GRAPH_URI,
                None,
            ),
        )

        rows = cursor.fetchall()

        cursor.close()
        conn.close()

        return {
            "status": "success",
            "row_count": len(rows),
            "results": serialize_rows(rows[:10]),
        }

    except Exception as e:
        import traceback
        return {
            "status": "error",
            "message": str(e),
            "trace": traceback.format_exc(),
        }



# --------------------------------------------------
# Run MCP
# --------------------------------------------------
if __name__ == "__main__":
    mcp.run(
        transport="streamable-http" )
"

 

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Re: UoM Conversion Issue: Decimal NOS Generated During GR...
entry.content:
In your case, Base UoM = KG ‚Üí SAP always stores stock in base UoM. Alternate UoM = NOS ‚Üí Conversion maintained (e.g., 25 KG = 1 NOS). At GR, if you enter 28 KG, SAP converts proportionally:

28 KG √∑ 25 KG/NOS = 1.12 NOS

Result: fractional NOS in stock ‚Üí mismatch with physical ‚Äúwhole pieces.‚Äù This is standard SAP behavior and conversions are mathematical, not rounded to whole units.

Below are the options you have

If no transactions exist yet

  • You can change the Base UoM in the material master. This is only possible before the first stock or PO is posted.

If transactions already exist

  • You cannot change the Base UoM.

Recommended approaches:

  • Create a new material with Base UoM = NOS and manage future receipts there.
  • Use batch characteristics or handling units to capture actual weight per NOS while keeping stock in whole pieces.
  • Keep the old material for legacy stock and gradually phase it out.

Workarounds without changing Base UoM

  • Use alternative UoM conversions and rounding profiles in purchasing to control order quantities.
  • Use batch management to record actual weight while stock remains in NOS.
  • Use Handling Unit Management (HUM) if logistics requires tracking piece + weight together.

entry.title: Re: SAP Certified - Implementation Consultant - SAP S/4HA...
entry.content:
Dear learners, 

even with the new upcoming version of our Finance exams (here: C_S4CFI), the Finance course content is still valid. So you can continue to prepare for your exam by studying those courses that are currently assigned to the certification that you are aiming at.

On the generic topis (those not explicitely related to Finance), please check the assigned courses as soon as the next exam version will be available. For some certifications, you will see a change in this (generic) area. However, this part of the content in total is small enough so it should not have an impact on your chance to pass the new exam.

To get ready for the new exam, you should be aware that this will be a practical exam, as announced here: Reimagining certification in the age of AI. With this, it is a good idea to gain hands-on experience during your preparation.  

I hope this helps.

Best regards, Doris Lindauer

entry.title: Re: How to properly save/post in EWM table /SCWM/HUHDR gi...
entry.content: Hi, I solved it. For the Inbound Delivery-HU mapping, get data from table /scwm/huref comparing fields docid and doccat. To maintain data in HU Header, first lock the HU with static method /scwm/cl_pack=>lock_hu, then call function module '/SCWM/HUHEADER_READ' to read the corresponding HU structure, and maintain the fields you want if success, and then update it via function module '/SCWM/HUHDR_INT_UPDATE'. Then the fields are now updated in the standard table.

entry.title: Re: Material Staging concept
entry.content:
Dear @Ibrahim_Samir47,

In Public Cloud material staging is the internal replenishment step that makes sure production components are physically and system-wise available at the issue point (production storage location / Production Supply Area) before you post the goods issue (GI 261) to the production order for consumption

What material staging means:

  • When a production order is created, SAP creates reservations for its BOM components
  • Very often, components are stored in a central warehouse/storage location, while the shop floor uses a different production storage location. So you first need to move/stage the components from the supply location to the production/issue location
  • That move to the shop floor is what SAP calls material staging, it‚Äôs not yet consumption

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/implementing-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-manufacturing/executing-production-orders_eebd35c8-b7ed-4f36-bd4a-fb527dfa1322

There are two often-confused GI ‚Äûmoments‚Äù:

1. GI for staging (replenishment / transfer posting)
This is the posting that finishes staging by transferring stock to the production storage location / PSA often via delivery/warehouse execution if WM is involved. In delivery-based production integration, once staging is completed GI is posted for the outbound delivery and the components are transferred to the production storage location and become available for consumption

2. GI to the production order (GI 261- consumption)
This is the real consumption posting that reduces inventory and posts the component cost to the production order. In Public Cloud you can do this:

    • Manually for example Post Goods Movement / Pick Components for Production Orders or
    • Automatically (backflush) during confirmations for example Confirm Production Order / Confirm Production Order Operation

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/implementing-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-warehouse-management/introducing-warehouse-production-integration_e54cb620-bcb1-4567-a55d-50ad2d2cc7c9

https://learning.sap.com/courses/implementing-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-warehouse-management/integrating-sap-s-4hana-private-cloud-sap-ewm-production-integration-processes_c3a2e7ad-262f-49d3-ad0d-368099b3f8ff

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('MIGO')/S35

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('CO27')/S35

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('CO11N')/S35

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('CO11N')/S35

Common staging approaches in Public Cloud:

  • Pull list / stock transfer staging moves required components from central storage to the production storage location so GI/backflush can happen from there
  • Kanban replenishment is triggered when containers are emptied it keeps small quantities available at production
  • Delivery-based staging with Warehouse Management / EWM integration staging creates an outbound delivery / outbound delivery order warehouse tasks move goods to the PSA and GI for the delivery finalizes the transfer to production storage

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/implementing-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-warehouse-management/introducing-warehouse-production-integration_e54cb620-bcb1-4567-a55d-50ad2d2cc7c9

Summary:

  • Staging = make it available at the shop floor (logistics / replenishment control)
  • Goods issue to the production order = used it in production (consumption and costing)

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Turning SAP BTP Integration Suite as a core ERP module for Business APIs & Business AI
entry.content:
ERP modernization is not enough

Over recent years, SAP clients have concentrated transformation efforts on S/4HANA to standardize processes, adopt cloud operating models (public, private, hybrid, sovereign), and enable continuous evolution. In parallel, the integration backbone must evolve from SAP PI-PO to SAP Integration Suite, ensuring your enterprise can operate API‚Äëfirst and Event‚Äëfirst, at the speed and scale modern business demands.

  • Context: SAP PI/PO maintenance aligns with NetWeaver 7.5 lifecycles. But this decision point is not just about end‚Äëof‚Äëmaintenance.
  • Imperative: Integration modernization is foundational to agility, AI‚Äëenabled processes, and resilient cloud operations across heterogeneous landscapes.

Beyond ‚Äúmiddleware‚Äù: What SAP Integration Suite really is

SAP Integration Suite is not a one‚Äëto‚Äëone PI-PO replacement. It‚Äôs an enterprise iPaaS on SAP BTP that unifies:

  • Cloud Integration for process and data integration
  • API Management to design, secure, publish, and govern Business APIs
  • Event Mesh for event‚Äëdriven architectures (EDA)
  • Integration Advisor and content packages for accelerated build
  • Monitoring and observability for end‚Äëto‚Äëend visibility across hybrid landscapes

This shift, from ‚Äúinterfaces‚Äù to "Business APIs", enables secure, discoverable, measurable, and even monetizable capabilities. It opens a path to Composable Architecture, where SAP and non‚ÄëSAP modules can be assembled, re‚Äëassembled, and composed to meet changing business needs.

Key benefits:

  • Speed: Faster delivery via reusable APIs, events, and prebuilt content
  • Quality: Strong governance, testing patterns, and observability
  • Resilience: Decoupling through asynchronous events and queues
  • Scale & Security: Unified policy enforcement, rate limiting, and consistent identity/access models

From Monolith to Modular: Real‚ÄëTime, Composable Integration

For Supply Chain, Manufacturing, and other data‚Äëintensive domains, real‚Äëtime integration is essential. By slicing the SAP monolith into modular building blocks, organizations can distribute, elevate, and govern data across the enterprise and partners ecosystem.

  • Decoupled communication allows plug‚Äëand‚Äëplay assembly of new components and systems.
  • Event‚Äëdriven patterns (domain events, queues, fan‚Äëout) reduce coupling and improve reliability.
  • Business APIs + events become the operating surface for cross‚Äësystem processes and innovation.

Preparing for Enterprise AI Agents: Event‚ÄëFirst, API‚ÄëFirst

AI is rapidly moving beyond chat into agents that act, use tools, and orchestrate work across systems. SAP is rolling out agentic capabilities on SAP BTP, including Joule Studio for Enterprise Agents, and secure access to foundation models via SAP AI Core and Generative AI Hub. Capabilities and patterns emerging in the ecosystem include:

  • Model Context Protocol (MCP) to simplify agent connections to tools and data
  • Agent‚Äëto‚ÄëAgent (A2A) patterns/protocols for secure, autonomous collaboration
  • AI Adapter patterns to link Integration Suite flows with GenAI tasks

In this operating model, Business APIs and events let agents subscribe to near real‚Äëtime signals, trigger actions/approvals, and enrich processes, reusing the IT estate and preserving existing investments while modernizing how work gets done.

A Practical PI-PO to Integration Suite Path

Treat the transformation as a program, not a lift‚Äëand‚Äëshift. A pragmatic path often includes:

  1. Assessment & Prioritization

    • Inventory interfaces (by business process, domain, criticality, volume, latency).
    • Identify patterns: synchronous APIs, asynchronous events, B2B/EDI, file, IDoc, RFC, REST/SOAP.

  2. Target Architecture & Design Principles

    • Define API‚Äëfirst and event‚Äëfirst standards (naming, versioning, domain event taxonomy).
    • Establish security models (identity, scopes, policies), observability, and SLAs.

  3. Co‚ÄëExistence & Strangler Pattern

    • Run PI-PO and Integration Suite side by side.
    • Gradually redirect traffic to new APIs/events, decommission legacy interfaces incrementally.

  4. Enablement & Guardrails

  5. Cutover & Stabilization

  6. Decommissioning & Continuous Evolution

    • Retire redundant PI-PO objects; codify lessons learned.
    • Expand event domains; evolve API products; onboard partners faster.

Anti‚ÄëPatterns to avoid

  • Lift‚Äëand‚Äëshift without rethinking business APIs and event domains
  • Point‚Äëto‚Äëpoint proliferation that undermines modularity and reuse
  • No product ownership, leaving integrations to drift without roadmaps or SLAs
  • Limited observability, making troubleshooting slow and costly

The takeaway

The ECC to S/4HANA journey modernizes the core.
The PI-PO to Integration Suite journey operationalizes Business APIs and events, enabling composable architectures, resilient integrations, and AI‚Äëready operating models.

Organizations that treat integration as a business platform - rather than a technical migration - will gain a durable advantage in agility, innovation, and speed to value.

Call to Action

Are you aligning the PI-PO to Integration Suite transformation with your Cloud ERP journey? Start with a portfolio assessment, define API‚Äëfirst and event‚Äëfirst standards, and establish a co‚Äëexistence plan that drives measurable business outcomes. The sooner you begin, the faster your enterprise will be ready for event‚Äëdriven processes and AI agents.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Issues during the Maintenance of Partner Roles for Business Partners
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

i have the following question for the maintenance of partner functions with the app "maintain business partner master data".
My Scenario is the following, i have a Business partner with the BP-Role "customer" and i have a BP with the BP-Role "contact person".
I want to assign this contact person to a custom partner function for this customer. When i go to the section partner roles in the sales area data of the customer, i can create a new entry with the custom partner function and then i have to select the business partner. 

At this point its important to mention that the system is customized in way, that this partner function only accepts contact persons as entries. So the BP with the BP role contact person has to have a contact person relationship and this relationship has a number assigned to it, which the SAP System reffers to as the "Partner number" (PARNR).

This number now has to be selected, when i want to assign the partner role and not the BP number that the contact person has.

If i want to do this in the older App/Transaction "BP" i cant just go to the partner role section and for the selection of the BP, i can filter the list to only those relationships that are related to this Customer.

BUT if i want to the same thing in the new App, i have to know the exact number of the relationship, because the app displays all relationships for all customers and i cant filter it in the same way.
The second issue is, that the Partner number i need to know, is also not displayed in the section "contact persons" in the customer or enywhere else and only the BP number of this contact person is displayed there.
As a result the only solutions i have found so far are, to use the Transaction "BP" or to use a custom CDS View to view the "partner number".

My question is, is this the standard behavoir ? Is there no way to filter the realtionships in a same way as in the Transaction BP ? Is there a standard way to display the "Partner number" in the app "Manage Business Partner Master Data", or do i need to create a custom field ?

Im greatfull for all answers and tipps.
Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Re: My Experience with the New SAP Exam Format¬†(2026)
entry.content:
@fsrgio , Correct, there were no formal rule provided like the previous exam format, where you for example had to be alone in a room with some other pre-requisites. 

I did a scenario based assessment, and what I found was that I had to provide verbal feedback to the AI Avatar, so I guess it would be useful to not have a lot of background noise that may interfere with your responses.

entry.title: Re: URL routing for CAP apps across BTP subaccounts without workzone
entry.content:
Hi @MioYasutake , thanks for your reply. Just for my understanding, I have to create in our case for every app a SM59 entry, because we don‚Äôt use the workzone and therefore every app has it‚Äôs own unique url on every subaccount with no pattern.

BTP_DEV
1. app1: https://btp-sap-dev-qweqwe.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com
2. app2: https://btp-sap-dev-yxcyxc.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com

BTP_QAS
1. app1: https://btp-sap-dev-lkjlkj.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com
2. app2: https://btp-sap-dev-iuiouio.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com

BTP_PROD
1. app1: https://btp-sap-dev-fgegde.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com
2. app2: https://btp-sap-dev-uchwjd.cfapps.hana.ondemand.com

If the app amount increases, my idea was to go with a standalone app router app in the BTP. The fiori tiles would point with a system alias to the router app and with a parameter, the router routes the request to the right app on the BTP. But I think your solution is simpler and less prone to errors.

entry.title: Re: Successfactors - Custom MDF - Unique Identifier
entry.content:
Use a sequence object configuration and assign a number range format (whatever you like) to the MDF field. and it will remain permanent for any change to the MDF record.

 

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/implementing-business-rules-in-sap-successfactors/creating-sequence-object

entry.title: BW on HANA ‚ÜíBW PCE (Lift & Shift): realistic split of SAP vs customer/partner Basis responsibilities
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are requested to support a BW on HANA 7.5 migration / lift to the private cloud edition.

I recently attended an SAP webinar about SAP Business Data Cloud and BW Private Cloud Edition. During the Q&A, I asked about the typical split of responsibilities and effort between SAP AG Basis and customer/partner Basis during a lift & shift migration of BW on HANA 7.5 to BW 7.5 PCE.

The answer was roughly ‚Äú~70% SAP AG Basis, ~30% customer‚Äù, but the presenter also mentioned this was more of a rough estimate.

I would be interested in hearing practical project experiences from the community:

  • Which activities are typically handled by SAP AG (beyond infrastructure and system copy)?

  • Which activities realistically remain with the customer or a partner (e.g. preparation, cleanup, user/role validation, testing, cutover coordination)?

  • In projects where the customer had limited or no PCE experience, how important was a partner Basis/BW role to bridge the gap?

  • Does it suffice to plan for 1 Clinent / Partner Basis resource + 1 SAP AG Basis + 1 BW resource?
  • How long does it take to move a 3 tier BW system having ca. 2 TB in prod into the cloud targetting for only a 2-tier landscape (QA/DEV together and PROD)
  • Did you face any major issues with connections to other systems, performance, process chains, queries/ reports, roles / access after the lift to PCE?

Thanks in advance for sharing your experience.

entry.title: Reset development object to SAP standard
entry.content:
Hi,

unfortunately we have several modifications in SAP development object using the SAP modification assistant.

We want to remove some of these modifications to switch back to the SAP default implementation.

The only way (that I know) to do this is by using transaction SPAU and reset the object to SAP.
In this case not only the code will reset to SAP implementation, the field "last changed by user" will be set to SAP aswell.
According to my experience so far, especially this field "last changed by user" of an object is the reason, if an object will be shown up during SPAU or not.

Is there any other way to reset a modified development object to SAP default?

If I simply remove the modifications, this only affects the code but not the field "last changed by user".

BR

entry.title: Fit-to-Standard Strategy for SFG Stock Consumption and PIR Reduction by Dependent Requirements
entry.content:
Problem Description:
We are seeking the correct Fit-to-Standard planning strategy in S/4HANA Public Cloud 2026 for a multi-level manufacturing scenario. Current testing with Strategies 10, 40 and 70 has not fulfilled all business requirements simultaneously.

 

Business Requirements:

  1. Stock Priority: The system must check and use available warehouse stock before triggering new planned orders.
  2. Dual Demand Consumption: Planned Independent Requirements (PIRs) for the SFG must be consumed by both:
    • Direct Sales Orders for the SFG.
    • Dependent Requirements triggered by FG production.
    • No Duplicate Planning: If a forecast (PIR) exists for 100 units and a Dependent Requirement for 40 units arrives, the system should only plan for a total of 100 units (60 PIR + 40 DepReq), not 140.

      Example Scenario for Analysis:

      • Material: SFG_001
      • Initial Stock: 20 EA
      • PIR (Requirement Type VSFB): 100 EA for Date X
      • New Requirement: FG order creates a Dependent Requirement of 50 EA for Date X.
      • Expected Result:
        • Dependent Requirement (50) consumes PIR (100), leaving 50 remaining PIR.
        • MRP sees total requirement (50 DepReq + 50 remaining PIR = 100 total).
        • MRP subtracts Stock (20) and creates a Planned Order for 80 EA
        • Observed Result in Starter System: MRP is creating separate orders for both PIR and Dependent Requirements, ignoring consumption logic.

           

          Please confirm the standard Strategy Group and Mixed MRP indicator combination for the 2026 release that enables PIR consumption by Dependent Requirements specifically for sub assemblies.

          # SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Manufacturing

entry.title: Select package size to solve 'Time out' Dump.
entry.content:
Hello community,

I have a SELECT on MSEG that is returning a TIME OUT error because I am not passing any key in the WHERE conditions.(I spoke with the functional consultant, but he said there‚Äôs no way to pass more parameters.)

 SELECT ebeln ebelp bwart matnr menge dmbtr budat_mkpf mjahr werks lgort shkzg
  FROM mseg INTO TABLE lt_mseg
  WHERE mjahr      IN so_mjahr AND
        werks      IN so_werks AND
        budat_mkpf IN so_date  AND
        matnr      IN so_matnr AND
        matnr      <> ''       AND
        bwart      IN so_bwart.

My question is: if I replace the SELECT with a SELECT PACKAGE SIZE and place a COMMIT WORK inside this SELECT PACKAGE SIZE, will it reset the rdisp/max_wprun_time, thus avoiding the dump due to time out?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Can I block invoice automatically if material not rec...
entry.content:
Dear @Gavara,

Yes you can automatically block or even prevent a supplier invoice when the goods receipt (GR) hasn‚Äôt been posted for the PO item

Option 1: GR-based Invoice Verification on the PO

If the PO item is set to GR-based invoice verification, invoices are verified against delivered quantities GRs. In practice the invoice quantity shouldn‚Äôt exceed delivered quantity so no GR leads to a quantity situation that will trigger blocking / restriction

Option 2: Tolerance limits that block invoices when GR quantity = 0

  • In Public Cloud tolerance limits are maintained via Set Tolerance Limits (101947) in CBC

 

  • To control whether the system warns / blocks / errors maintain message behavior in Define Message Types for Area M8 (102091)

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3052672

Once GR is posted and you‚Äôre ready to pay use the Release Blocked Invoices app

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('MRBR')/S35

IMPORTANT: It can release payment blocks that were set during invoice creation in Create Supplier Invoice / Create Supplier Invoice Advanced

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3061453

ALTERNATIVE: If you want no invoice until GR by design then onsider Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) the system settles based on GRs so you don‚Äôt process supplier invoices for those vendors

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/796fb6531de6b64ce10000000a174cb4.html

Best Regards,

Dawid
